title: 2022 Survey Results
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:bedrock]]

[[div class="footer-wikiwalk-nav"]]
= << [[[2018-survey-results|2018]]] | [[[2019-survey-results|2019]]] | [[[2020-survey-results|2020]]] | [[[2021-survey-results|2021]]] | [[[2022-survey-results|2022]]] | [[[2023-survey-results|2023]]] >>
[[/div]]

[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

+ Introduction

Welcome to the official SCP Foundation Wiki 2022 Community Survey results! We'd like to thank everyone for participating. It's always amazing to see just how many people submit responses, and it's wonderful to know how many people enjoy the wiki and the SCP fandom as a whole. This year, we had a total of 6,048 responses, which is in line with the previous two years. As always, this feedback will help us to improve the site and make it a better experience for everyone.

Furthermore, as a reminder, we will be having open town halls with open response forms halfway through the upcoming year for you to voice specific hopes, requests, and concerns you have for the site.

A brief summary of major takeaways from this survey:
* Nearly all of our respondents used the English wiki. This is to be expected, as our survey was conducted in English and sent primarily to the English-speaking community
* Over half of our survey respondents were 18 years old or lower
* Over half of our respondents live in the United States, with almost no other countries commanding a plurality.
* While almost 98% of our respondents read articles on their primary wiki, only about 7% comment regularly and only about 6% write regularly.
* Despite only 666 total people saying they either write for the site, produce other media for the site, or translate articles for the site, 1,400 people responded with a 4 or a 5 to questions of how easy it was to post to the site. Clearly, this question requires more clarification to distinguish between posting comments and posting articles/art. We'll make this improvement next year.
* 46% of our respondents did not feel that any of our suggested incentives would encourage them to provide reviews of authors' work. If you are part of this group, feel free to respond to our summer town halls describing what would encourage you to conduct such reviews.
* While there is a large population of SCP roleplayers on Roblox, only 413 respondents stated they had any roleplay activities. We believe we simply didn't target this population.

While our survey is comprehensive, this data report is not. Please let us know if you have additional requests for visualizations in the comments section below or to our social media handles, and we'll see what we can do!

Thank you for being part of the SCP experience, be it as a reader, writer, or fan.

[[toc]]

+ Accessibility
The following questions asked the user to respond on a scale from 1-5. Except where otherwise stated, a score of 5 is the "best" case and a score of 1 is the "worst" case. 

On a scale of 1-5, how accessible do you find the site to use?
||~ Response ||~ # of Responses ||~ % ||
|| 1.0 - Not at all accessible || 37 ||0.61% ||
|| 2.0 || 169 ||2.79% ||
|| 3.0 || 917 ||15.16% ||
|| 4.0 || 2886 ||47.72% ||
|| 5.0 - Very accessible || 2003 ||33.12% ||
